Key:
(After school, I waited in my classroom for Kurumi to
come back.)
Kurumi's late...

Uh, the movie's going to start at... Oh, we still have
enough time.

She said she's helping Tama-chan, but maybe I
should have gone with her.

(Today we have plans to go see the movie we talked
about when she visited my house the other day.)

(But Kurumi was asked by the Social Studies teacher―
Tamae Okamine-sensei, also known as Tama-chan―to
help her.
Hmm...

I feel dumb just sitting around here, so maybe I'll go
check on them to see if I can help.

(I went to the classroom where she was supposed to
be, but no one was there. Seems like they've already
finished their work. Maybe we just missed each other.)

Hmm. It's probably just bad timing... I guess I should
go back.

(I went toward the stairs so I could go back to the
classroom. Just then―)
Huh... Kurumi?

(I saw someone who looked like Kurumi head toward
the rooftop. Actually... I know it's Kurumi. I guess
I'll go after her.)

(I went up to the rooftop and saw Kurumi there,
looking out beyond the fence. She seemed to be
watching the students walk home.)
Kurumi?
Oh... Shido-san.
Gosh. Don't scare me.
I was worried that you had gone home without me.

Sorry. I wanted to go and help you, but seems like we
just missed each other.
You... wanted to help me?

Yeah. I figured we'd be able to finish sooner and
leave together.
Well, I guess in the end we missed each other.
So what were you doing here?

Well, Okamine-sensei asked me to look for you,
Shido-san.

Tama-chan did? I wonder what she wanted to talk to
me about.
(I had no idea why she wanted me.)
Did she say anything else, Kurumi?

All she said was to call you... Come to think of it,
Shido-san... Have you submitted your report?
Report? OH! The social studies one!

(I finally remembered. That's right. Today was the day
my report was due.)
Aw, man. I totally forgot.
Don't tell me you haven't touched it.

Oh, well I did do it. It's just that I forgot to bring it...
Please believe me.

It's pointless whether I believe you or not... But I
think.... Rather, that's definitely what she
was calling you for.
Ah, I see. That's not good...
Oh? What's not good?

Well, it's still early, so I can see her telling me to go
back home to pick it up...

But it is your fault for forgetting, Shido-san. You
can't blame her for telling you that.
Yeah, but... But I made plans with you...

(The movie Kurumi said she wanted to see a little
while ago. Today's the last day to see it in theaters.
If we miss it, God knows when we can see it next...)
So... I'm the cause of your stress?
Huh? Well, um...
(I blushed. I couldn't help but scratch my cheek.)

If I miss the chance today, we won't be able to see
the movie, right? We don't even know when it'll be out
to buy later...
So what do you plan on doing?

...I feel bad for Tama-chan, but I'm going to submit
my report tomorrow.

(It's not like I didn't do it. I'm sure she'll forgive
me if I submit it tomorrow.)

...So I'm sorry, but can you tell Okamine-sensei that
I've already gone home?
(Kurumi seemed to contemplate the idea for a moment.)
...Very well. You just leave it to me.
(She spoke with her usual bright smile.)
Thanks! All right, let's move on then!

First, I'm going to go get my bag from the classroom.
I figured it'd be in the way, so I left it behind. The
movie tickets are still in there...
Got it. It's on my way, so I'll go with you.
All right. Let's go, then.

Come to think of it, what did she ask you to help her
with, Kurumi?

Organizing the worksheets for the next class. It was
pretty heavy, so she must have wanted help.
Ah, makes sense. You're the class president, huh.
(Kurumi suddenly stopped.)
Kurumi? What's the matter?
Shhh. Quiet, Shido-san... Do you hear that?
Huh?

(I listened carefully. I heard a familiar voice coming
from the hallway.)
Uuuum. Have you seen Tokisaki-san or Itsuka-kun?
I seee. Thank you～
...That voice!

(Speak of the devil. The owner of the voice was
Tama-chan, a.k.a. Okamine-sensei.)
Shido-san, hurry.
Yeah...

(Kurumi and I nodded at one another and turned
around, running back the other way.)
What are you going to do?

...First, let's go downstairs and take the long way
around to the classroom.
Got it.

(We looked around and went down the lower hallway.
We managed to find a way into the classroom.)
All right. Seems like we beat her here.

Come to think of it, I came with you... but I could
have bought some time earlier, couldn't I?
No point in thinking about that now. Anyways, hang on.

(I went straight to my desk, but... For some reason,
my bag was missing.)
What the...
What's the matter?
My bag is gone...
Huh?

(I looked around, but I couldn't find my bag
anywhere.)
Of all times...
Shido-san, over here.

(Kurumi was moving toward the blackboard. I followed
her and saw my bag there with a note.)

What's this? "Shido forgot his bag, so someone either take it
to him, or please let him know about it.―Tonomachi.
Ah, damn it, Tonomachi. You scared me...

(I'm sure he did it for my benefit, but... Gosh, he
didn't have to do that...)
Oh, well. I found my bag, so let's hurry up and go.
(Just then Kurumi raised her hand to stop me.)
Kurumi, what's the matter?
Shido-san... No. ...She's coming!
Huh? O-Oh, no...!

(I listened carefully and heard a familiar voice
approaching.)
Tokisaki-saaaaaan. Itsuka-kuuuun?
Are you guys around here～? I need to talk to you～
...This isn't good.

(I heard Okamine-sensei's footsteps coming straight
toward us. Even though I managed to get ahold of my
bag, we were still going to get caught at this rate.)

Shido-san. What do you want to do? If she comes in
here, we'll get caught.
*grunt*. I can't leave the classroom now...
There's no use... Let's give up.
Kurumi, help me!

(It's too late to run and hide at this point. The
situation was dire.)
...Let's give up.
...Shido-san?

(Knowing Okamine-sensei, she may just wait until
tomorrow if I asked. I decided to just give in.)

It's pointless. There's nowhere to hide in here, and I
can't exactly run for it.
―Huh?
I'm sorry... But we're going to have to give up.
Kurumi. I'm so sor...

(I looked down. Okamine-sensei's footsteps were
getting louder and louder.)

(I had already given up, but Kurumi's powerful voice
resounded in my ears.)
...That's not like you, Shido-san.
Huh?
There's still a place to hide.
So please don't give up.
Kurumi...

(Hearing her powerful words, I decided to take a
chance. The sparkle in my eyes returned, and I wanted
to hear Kurumi's thoughts.)
Got it. But there's no place to hide. Or is there?
That would be... here.
W-Whoaaaa!

(Before I could answer, Kurumi yanked my arm and
shoved me under the teacher's podium.)
H-Hey, what are you... GAH!

(Kurumi sandwiched my face with something soft,
covered my head with something, and closed off the
bottom of the podium.)
*grunt*... What's going on?
Sh-Shido-san, don't move!
K-Kurumi? What's going on―
HYAHH! S-Stop. It tickles.

(Judging by our back-and-forth, I had a hunch about
what was going on.)

(Basically this is the only thing that could be done
now. Then that means―)
Ah... Shido-san, please. Don't breathe too hard.
Your breath... It tickles my legs.
B-But...
AH! ...Shido-san, are you... doing it on purpose?
N-No, it's not like that! I...
Hya...?! Gosh!

(Her soft flesh. Her sweet scent. Her moist, warm
skin. And Kurumi's sweet sighs. Every time I heard
them, my heart rang like a bell.)
H-Hey, Kurumi? I don't think this will cut it...

Ahh... Please hang in there... until we can get rid
of... O-Okamine-sensei.
I... will... mm... endure it...
O-Okay.

(So we maintained that position for a little while
as Okamine-sensei neared.)
Is she here?

No. It seems as though sh-she's standing in front of
the classroom.

I think she's... hah...! She's responding to a text
message.
I-I see... Th-Then maybe we can adjust our position―
He... Shido-san, don't move!
Yeah, but it's hard to breathe―
HYAAAAA...!
Whoa. I-I'm sorry!

No... Don't talk... Shido-san, your breath is on my
thighs―

(The more I moved or panicked, the more Kurumi's body
squirmed, and her sweet moans escaped her mouth
involuntarily.)

(Even if I made the slightest movement or talked
just a little, it stimulated her... I don't know what else
I can do.)
(As my mind went blank, the split second that felt like a lifetime passed.)
I think we're safe now.
R-Really?
Yes. She seems to be gone.
Phew... We're saved.

Sh-Sh-Sh-Shido-san?! P-Please... if you're going to
talk, please do so after you get out from under there!
O-Okay! So―

(I crawled out from under the podium. Kurumi shot me
a tough look, but... she and I managed to make it out
of our bind.)

(It was too late to run or hide. The situation was
dire.)
...*grunt*.
...Shido-san?

(But if I give up here, then my plans to see the movie
with Kurumi would be ruined. This was all for Kurumi.
She was so excited to watch it.)

(I'm sure there's still a way. I... won't give up
yet!)
Let's calm down. There has to be a way somehow.
A way... Do you have any ideas?

(I looked around. I needed to find some place to
hide.)
If I just hide, we should be able to get away with it!
We need to find a hiding place...

(The only place I could hide in the classroom would
be in the storage locker or the teacher's podium.)
The podium... That's it!
Sorry, Kurumi. Help me!
Help you... What do you want me to do?

I'm going to hide under the podium, so I want you to
close it off with your legs and block me from the
teacher's view.
(When I said that, Kurumi gave a naughty smile.)
Wh-What's the matter?
My, my. Very well, then.
Huh?
I was just thinking the same thing.

I see. Then I don't have to explain anything! Thanks,
Kurumi!
Hehe. Understood.

(After I nodded, I grabbed my bag and I hid under the
podium.)
All right, Kurumi, hurry!

(All Kurumi had to do was stand there and let me
hide―)
Excuse me, Shido-san.
Huh... WHOA?!

(Suddenly my vision went dark. I felt something soft
smush into my face.)
K-Kurumi? What's―
Shido-san. Don't move.
What are you doing―
Quiet. Okamine-sensei is almost here...

(Just then, the door opened. My breath caught in my
throat.)
Oh, there you are, Tokisaki-san.
Oh, Okamine-sensei.
What are you doing there?
Hehe. I was just looking something up.

(My cheeks were pressed against something unbelievably
soft. A lovely scent. Kurumi's body heat. I could feel
it on my cheeks and shoulders.)

(I don't know if Kurumi knew what was going through
my mind, but she kept on talking with Okamine-sensei.)
Sooo, were you able to find Itsuka-kun?

I'm sorry. It seems by the time I started searching
for him, he had already gone home.

(It was getting hard for me to breathe, so I listened
in to find the right opportunity to try and move my
head.)
If I can find h―
HYAH!
(Just then, Kurumi's body jolted mid-sentence.)
Tokisaki-san? Is something the matter?
N-Nothing! I thought I felt something touch my face.
(I could hear a trace of panic in Kurumi's voice.)
A-As long as you're okay...
Right, Tokisaki-san. So about Itsuka-kun earlier―
(Hearing my name, I froze.)
Oh... Y-Yes.
T-Tokisaki-san? What's the matter?
N-Nothing is the matter... I promise.
Really?

(Seems like whenever I moved, I was inadvertently
stimulating Kurumi. S-Sorry, Kurumi.)
Tokisaki-san, don't tell me...

(Crap. Did she catch us?! I tried to stay quiet, but
the situation made me breathe even more heavily.)
Hya... Hauu!
Could you be... sick?

Mmm. Yes... that's right. My body... is just... isn't
feeling well.

(Every time I tried to breathe in from between her
thighs, Kurumi's body quivered, and the sweet anguish
I could hear in her voice made my mind go numb.)
That's not good! You need to go home immediately!

No. There's something I still have to do here. So when
I'm finished with that...
If it's something for school, then I'll just...

N-No, I'm fine! I want to do the job with which I was
tasked as class president.

(I finally got some air in, and realized that Kurumi
had lost her composure. This was far from her usual
behavior.)

Is that so? Then, you take care of yourself and hurry
home, okay?

Oh, and if you have a chance to see Itsuka-kun, then
please tell him to bring his report tomorrow, okay?
...Understood. Good-bye, Okamine-sensei...

(And so we were able to avoid any trouble. Well..
afterwards Kurumi straight up scolded me.)
That was a lot more fun than I thought.
Yes. It was very good.

(We safely got out of the school, and as planned,
we went to see the movie together.)
Oh... Kurumi?
What is it?
Um... Thanks for today.
No problem. I'm glad I could be of use.
You always help me out.
But today... You've gone too far.
...Huh?
Therefore... Why don't we say you owe me one for now?
Okay. Well, I guess you have a point.

(Even Kurumi was tossed around today... And it was
all my fault.)
...Kurumi, you're adorable.
Excuse me...? Could you say that again?
Nothing. Thanks for today, Kurumi.
Gosh, Shido-san. You always play it off like that...
(And we slowly began the walk home.)
